amendment.description: Amendment incorporates into the bill portions of H.R. 1778, the Defense Reform Act. It provides for various organizational, management, and business practices reforms; streamlines acquisition procedures; reduces headquarters staffs by 25 percent; reduces personnel employed in acquisition and transportation organizations of the Department of Defense; mandates that certain commercial functions including finance and accounting services be competitively procured; and authorizes the Navy to enter into contracts for the long-term lease or charter of newly built auxiliary support vessels.
amendment.purpose: An amendment consisting of the text of H.R. 1778 with some modifications to incorporate into the bill only the non-environmental provisions of that measure. The amendment provides for several organizational, structural, defense business practice, and acquisition reforms---including a reduction of 25% in military headquarters staff by the year 2001; a 42% reduction in the acquisition workforce by 2001; the establishment of a commission on defense reorganization and streamlining; the expansion of streamlined acquisition procedures; and the institution of government purchase cards for items costing $2,500 or less.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Spence amendment (A002) Agreed to by recorded vote: 405 - 14 (Roll no. 215).
